data.title: Series I: American Publications: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Communist and Socialist Serials: NYU Special Collections Finding Aids
data.meta_description: The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Communist and Socialist Serials collects 1,945 serials and publications chronicling the activity of national and international Communist and Socialist groups, published between 1850 and 2013, originally received by the Tamiment Library through subscriptions, donations, and as part of archival collections. The majority of the collection consists of incomplete runs of newsletters, newspapers, reports, information bulletins, theoretical journals, and informally prepared communiquÃ©s issued by political groups. The serials document the rise and fall of Communism and Socialism at a granular level, rich in detailed first-person accounts of key political events: World War II, the Vietnam conflict, German reunification. Publications originate from national political parties, smaller splinter groups and factions, current affairs magazines, and unions and labor coalitions at the local and national level. The collection contains hundreds of titles documenting Communism and Socialism internationally, in serials and reports emanating from established national political organizations, as well as material documenting political activity in Puerto Rico, Canada, South Africa, and elsewhere. No complete runs of publications are contained herein, and in most cases only a handful of issues of each publication are held.
data.text: This series collects 1,260 publications -- serials, journals, magazines, newsletters, bulletins, pamphlets, and reports -- issued by a variety of local and national parties, organizations, political organizers, commentators, and affiliated interest groups in the United States. The majority of the series collects regularly published bulletins, newsletters, and newspapers, circulating news and discussion within communities of Communist Party members and activists. One-off reports and occasional papers address a variety of topics in detail, including working regulations, meetings and conventions, and Communist and Socialist movements abroad. Well represented serials in this collection include Burning Spear, Freedom Socialist, The Militant, Socialist Workers Party's Bulletin, and the Central Committee of the Workers League's Bulletin, alongside various titles dedicated to social justice issues intersecting with communist and socialist thought, among them the Gay Socialist Newsletter, Asians in Struggle, and publications dedicated to groups affiliated with the Democratic Socialists of America (including DSA Green News, Socialist Perspectives on Race, and the Democratic Socialists of America Feminist Commission's Not Far Enough).
